business.headline: IRFC shares jump over 7% today. Here's what's driving the rallyAt around 10:32 am, IRFC shares were trading 7.42% higher on the BSE at Rs 130.50, emerging as one of the top gainers among public sector stocks during the session.

RVNL, IRFC, IRCTC: Why are these railway stocks rising today?At around 9:55 am, IRCTC was up 1.35% at Rs 688.85 on the BSE, while Rail Vikas Nigam Limited surged 8.94% to Rs 376.60. Indian Railway Finance Corporation also saw strong buying, rising 6.07% to Rs 128.87.

Eggs on the boil: Why prices are high and when they might coolEgg prices reflect a market resetting after years of strain, where higher costs, cautious supply, and steady demand mean consumers should expect easing, not a return to cheap eggs soon.

Why Dalal Street's Santa rally failed to take off this yearWhat began as a tentative Santa rally faded quietly, leaving benchmark indices range-bound and investors asking why seasonal cheer failed to translate into sustained gains. Read on to find out what it means for Dalal Street investors.

Sensex, Nifty slip at open as Dalal Street rally loses momentumAt around 9:18 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 95.26 points at 85,313.44, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 40.80 points to trade at 26,101.30. Broader markets also traded in the red, with volatility ticking up during early trade.

Why are egg prices crossing Rs 8 in many Indian cities this winter?Eggs, often seen as one of the most affordable sources of protein, are turning expensive in many Indian cities this winter. As prices move past Rs 8 per piece, consumers are keen to understand what is pushing rates higher.

Revised or belated ITR? What taxpayers should file before December 31With the December 31 deadline fast approaching, many taxpayers are unsure whether they need to file a revised or a belated income tax return. Recent alerts from the income tax department have made it even more important to understand the right option.

8th Pay Commission: How inflation could shape salary and pension revisionsAs discussions around the 8th Pay Commission gather pace, the debate around pay hikes has already begun. Inflation may be under control on paper, yet higher rents and household expenses are shaping expectations from the next salary and pension revision.

Why EPF claims get rejected and how employees can avoid itAn EPF claim rejection can be frustrating, especially when employees need the money urgently. Understanding why claims get rejected and how to avoid common mistakes can save time and stress.

Centre okays 3 new airlines after IndiGo chaos: Shankh Air, Al Hind Air, FlyExpressShankh Air, Al Hind Air and FlyExpress have received no objection certificates from the civil aviation ministry, as the government looks to reduce heavy dependence on a few airlines following recent disruption at IndiGo.
Sensex ends 116 points lower, Nifty below 26,200; Trent gained 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 116.14 points to close at 85,408.70, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 35.05 points to end at 85,408.70.

Facing pension delays? EPFO sets new rules to fix EPS contribution mistakesPension delays have long been a worry for many employees. To address this, the EPFO has introduced new rules to correct mistakes in EPS contributions and ensure pension claims are settled smoothly.

8th Pay Commission: How the fitment factor will shape salary and pension increasesAs talks around the 8th Pay Commission gather pace, government employees and pensioners are closely watching one number that could change their monthly income. The fitment factor is set to be the main driver of salary and pension revisions under the new pay panel.

Still waiting for your income tax refund? Simple ways to check your ITR statusWaiting for an income tax refund can be frustrating, especially after filing your return on time. While delays are common, tracking your ITR status online is easy and can give you clarity on where things stand.

Pakistan sells national carrier PIA for Rs 4,300 crore after IMF diktatPakistan, which is surviving on international loans and dole, sold its flag-carrier Pakistan International Airlines (PIA) on Wednesday for PKR 13,500 crore (Rs 4,300 crore). The Pakistani government had to privatise the airline under IMF loan conditions. The Arif Habib Group emerged as the highest bidder.

Coal India shares continue to rally. What's behind the rise?Coal India's sharp rally reflects a mix of restructuring signals, strong fundamentals and sector-wide PSU momentum. With multiple subsidiaries headed for listings, investors see fresh value creation opportunities driving renewed interest in the stock.

Saleem Ahmad takes charge as RVNL CMD, replacing Sukhmal Chand JainSaleem Ahmad is a civil engineering graduate from Jamia Millia Islamia University and brings more than 35 years of experience across large-scale construction and infrastructure projects.

Do you need to file revised ITR after the Income Tax Department's message?The tax department's risk management alert serves as a cautionary prompt, not a formal notice. Taxpayers need revised ITRs only if there are mismatches. Those with correct claims can wait as refunds resume after verification.

Gold rallies to fresh high: Key reasons behind rally and support levels to watchSpot gold rose 0.8% to a fresh all-time high of $4,524 per ounce. With this jump, gold has gained around 72% so far this year.

ITR on hold? Tax department issues clarification on 'risk management' alertsThe tax department's latest clarification aims to ease taxpayer anxiety, stressing that the alerts are advisory and encourage voluntary correction. Refunds will resume once discrepancies are fixed or claims are verified as genuine.

entertainment.headline: Stranger Things 5 V2 review: A set-up heavy chapter that's frustratingly cautiousRelease Date:Fri Dec 26, 2025 Stranger Things season 5 volume 2 arrives with high expectations and emotional character moments. The season tests patience with slow pacing but highlights key relationships and plot reveals.

Gaurav Khanna defends wife Akansha Chamola after dance video backlash Bigg Boss 19 winner Gaurav Khanna has defended his wife, Akanksha Chamola, following online criticism after a video of her dancing at a party gained attention.

Mark vs 45 box office Day 1: Sudeep's film outperforms Shiva Rajkumar's actioner Kichcha Sudeep's Mark outperformed Shiva Rajkumar and Upendra's 45 at the Karnataka box office on Christmas Day, posting higher occupancy percentages and audience turnout across key regions.

Karisma Kapoor's children honour late father Sunjay with polo jerseys on Christmas Sunjay Kapur's children, Samaira and Kiaan, wore their late father's polo jerseys during Christmas. A picture of their touching gesture has emerged online.

Stranger Things Season 5 Volume 2 out: Noah Schnapp thanks fans for their love Stranger Things Season 5 Volume 2 is now streaming on Netflix. Actor Noah Schnapp marked the occasion by posting a heartfelt note on Instagram. He encouraged fans to cherish the final moments of the series as it reaches its concluding episodes.

Rashmika, Vijay Deverakonda wear similar hoodies as they jet off for Christmas trip Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda were seen in matching hoodies during their Christmas vacation. The couple's engagement rumours continue as they prepare for a wedding in early 2026.

Dhurandhar Ranveer cheers as Rupali Ganguly's mother wins internet with Shararat Dhurandhar star Ranveer Singh shared his excitement after watching a video of Rupali Ganguly's mother dancing to the song Shararat. The latter has won the heart of not just the starcast of the film but also celebrities and fans.

Sunny and Bobby Deol to honour Dharmendra with special Ikkis screening Dharmendra's sons Sunny and Bobby Deol are set to hold a special screening of the late actor's final film, 'Ikkis', in Mumbai next week. The film is slated to release in theatres on January 1, 2026.

Vrusshabha box office Day 1: Mohanlal's film rakes in Rs 70 lakh, his lowest opening Mohanlal's latest release Vrusshabha struggled at the box office on its opening day, recording only Rs 61 lakh in India and facing harsh criticism from audiences across different language versions.

Dhurandhar box office Day 21: Ranveer Singh film mints over Rs 975 crore globally The spy thriller Dhurandhar, starring Ranveer Singh and directed by Aditya Dhar, experienced strong box office growth on Christmas. As it sets eyes on the Rs 1000 crore club globally, the film outshone Kartik Aaryan, Ananya Panday's film Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri.

Dhurandhar's Mohammad Aalam makes Gaurav Gera easy to miss and hard to forget Gaurav Gera surprised audiences with his almost unrecognisable outing as Mohammad Aalam in Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar, away from his usual comic image. As a Lyari juice seller who is actually a handler, his subtle but important role adds strength to the film's spy story.

Tu Meri Main Tera box office Day 1: Kartik film opens strong amid Dhurandhar wave Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday's latest film 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' which debuted on Christmas Day, recorded notable first-day collections amid major releases.

Jennifer Lopez to Cardi B: Hollywood stars celebrate Christmas, see pics Hollywood celebrities gave fans a glimpse into their Christmas celebrations through social media photos and posts. From Mariah Carey's family party with Santa, Jennifer Lopez and Justin Bieber's family celebrations to Selena Gomez's first Christmas as a married couple, stars shared cosy moments online.

Bridgerton Season 4 trailer: Check out release dates of Part 1 and Part 2 The trailer for the fourth season of the show Bridgerton was released, coinciding with Christmas. The fourth season, which will revolve around Benedict Bridgerton and Sophia Baek's romance, will be released in two parts on Netflix.

Katrina-Vicky's first Christmas as parents is filled with love, joy and peace. Pic Katrina Kaif brightened Christmas with a cheerful post featuring husband Vicky Kaushal and brother Sunny Kaushal in a fun moment.

Grateful for 2025, Samantha shares unseen wedding pic with goofy Raj Nidimoru As 2025 ends, Samantha reflected on a year filled with personal joy and professional achievements, sharing never-before-seen moments from her wedding and career. One of the photos featured her husband Raj from their wedding day.

Inside Kapoor family's Christmas with Ranbir-Alia, Riddhima and Neetu. Pic Riddhima Kapoor Sahni shared a heartfelt glimpse of the Kapoor family's warm Christmas celebration. The photo features Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt, and Neetu Kapoor, among others.

Ustad Rashid Khan's son Armaan Khan cancels Bangladesh concerts amid unrest Indian classical singer Armaan Khan has cancelled his upcoming performances in Bangladesh in response to the recent unrest. The situation has raised serious safety concerns among artists and cultural organisations amid widespread protests and violence.

Boman Irani revisits Virus as 3 Idiots marks 16 years, shares AI video As 3 Idiots completes 16 years, Boman Irani revisited his iconic character Virus by sharing an AI-generated video celebrating the film's legacy.

general news.headline: US bombs Nigeria over attacks on Christians, Trump wishes dead terrorists Merry XmasNigeria has faced years of extremist violence from Islamic State (IS) terrorists and Boko Haram, with attacks often hitting civilians and religious communities across the country's north.

Indian student, 20, shot dead near Toronto campus; hunt on for culpritShivank Avasthi, an Indian doctoral student, was shot dead near the University of Toronto Scarborough campus. Toronto police said he was gunned down in the Highland Creek Trail–Old Kingston Road area.

Udaipur IT firm CEO, executive offer lift to colleague after party, rape her in carAn IT company manager alleged that the firm's CEO and a senior executive offered her a lift after a New Year party in Udaipur and raped her in a moving car.

They asked for our Aadhaar: Co-worker recalls lynching of Bengal man in OdishaPolice arrested six men after a 19-year-old migrant worker from West Bengal was killed in Odisha. The victim's co-workers alleged that the attackers demanded Aadhaar cards, suspecting them to be Bangladeshis.

Stranger Things 5 V2 review: A set-up heavy chapter that's frustratingly cautiousRelease Date:Fri Dec 26, 2025Stranger Things season 5 volume 2 arrives with high expectations and emotional character moments. The season tests patience with slow pacing but highlights key relationships and plot reveals.

Live: Bajrang Dal, VHP hold protest over lynching of Hindus in BangladeshBangladesh Violence Live Updates: A Hindu man has been beaten to death in Bangladesh, the second such killing in days, heightening concerns over the safety of religious minorities in the country. Local media reported that 29-year-old Amrit Mondal, also known as Samrat, was attacked and killed in Rajbari's Pangsha sub-district late on Wednesday night, around three-and-a-half hours from Dhaka. The killing follows the lynching of Dipu Chandra Das, whose body was set on fire earlier this week. The latest incident coincides with the return of senior opposition leader Tarique Rahman to Bangladesh after 17 years in self-imposed exile, as he pledged to ensure safety and justice if his party wins next year's elections. Stay with IndiaToday.com for live updates-

Married woman shot in Gurugram club for rejecting friend's marriage proposalA Delhi man allegedly shot a 25-year-old married woman inside a Gurugram club after she rejected his marriage proposal. Police arrested the accused and his accomplice from Uttar Pradesh, and the investigation is ongoing.

Eggs on the boil: Why prices are high and when they might coolEgg prices reflect a market resetting after years of strain, where higher costs, cautious supply, and steady demand mean consumers should expect easing, not a return to cheap eggs soon.

When some in NDA sought Vajpayee's exit, Mamata stood like a rockSome within the NDA flirted with the idea of moving beyond Atal Bihari Vajpayee and running a government without him after he lost the no-confidence motion in 1999. However, TMC chief Mamata Banerjee and the MDMK's Vaiko made it clear there would be no NDA without Vajpayee at the helm, recalls the ex-PM's media advisor Ashok Tandon.

Vijay Hazare Trophy live score: Kohli out for 77, Rishabh Pant at crease for DelhiVijay Hazare Trophy live: Virat Kohli has hit a rapid 29-ball fifty for Delhi against Gujarat. He has looked at his aggressive best. Earlier, Rohit Sharma got dismissed for golden duck against Uttarakhand.

Dhurandhar's Mohammad Aalam makes Gaurav Gera easy to miss and hard to forgetGaurav Gera surprised audiences with his almost unrecognisable outing as Mohammad Aalam in Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar, away from his usual comic image. As a Lyari juice seller who is actually a handler, his subtle but important role adds strength to the film's spy story.

Not just Christians, assault on all of us: Shashi Tharoor on Christmas vandalismCongress MP Shashi Tharoor has expressed deep concern over rising fear and anxiety among Christians in India ahead of Christmas 2025, citing multiple attacks and disruptions. He emphasises that these incidents threaten the nation's shared culture and calls for urgent government action to uphold constitutional freedoms.

Dark Prince Tarique Rahman and his anti-India Hawa Bhaban pastNow considered the PM-in-waiting, BNP leader Tarique Rahman returned to Bangladesh on Thursday after 17 years in exile. His past, when his mother, Khaleda Zia, was the PM, has murky chapters with an alternative power centre at Dhaka's Hawa Bhaban.

RVNL, IRFC, IRCTC: Why are these railway stocks rising today?At around 9:55 am, IRCTC was up 1.35% at Rs 688.85 on the BSE, while Rail Vikas Nigam Limited surged 8.94% to Rs 376.60. Indian Railway Finance Corporation also saw strong buying, rising 6.07% to Rs 128.87.

Junta with nuclear weapons, US should worry: What Putin told Bush about Pak in 2001When expressing his views on Pakistan to George W. Bush, Putin wondered why the idea of a country with "no democracy" possessing a nuclear stockpile did not concern the West.

Won't swear to the King: Sikh lawyer forces Canada to drop monarch oathSikh lawyer Prabhjot Singh Wirring forced Canadian courts to end a century-old monarch oath, arguing it violated religious freedom, triggering a landmark ruling with nationwide impact.

Stranger Things Season 5 Volume 2 out: Noah Schnapp thanks fans for their loveStranger Things Season 5 Volume 2 is now streaming on Netflix. Actor Noah Schnapp marked the occasion by posting a heartfelt note on Instagram. He encouraged fans to cherish the final moments of the series as it reaches its concluding episodes.

Trivandrum triumph a foregone conclusion? India eye series win vs toothless Sri LankaIND-W vs SL-W, 3rd T20I: Harmanpreet Kaur's side have dominated the five-match T20I series so far, winning both matches in Vizag and now looking to carry that momentum into Trivandrum.

Anybody else? Melania cuts Trump short mid-praise on White House Christmas callDonald Trump's Christmas Eve NORAD call went viral after an awkward moment when Melania Trump cut short his on-air praise, adding to a series of unscripted jokes and exchanges with children.

Don't get rid of our dog: Worried about sick pet, Lucknow sisters die by suicideDeeply emotionally attached to their dog, two sisters allegedly consumed phenyl. However, before death, their last wish to their mother was for their pet German Shepherd dog. What was the last wish? Read this report ...

From junkyard to genius: Surat students build India's first AI superbike GarudaThree mechanical engineering students from Surat have built 'Garuda', India's first AI-enabled electric bike prototype made using nearly 50% scrap material. Driven by a Raspberry Pi–based system with sensors, cameras and voice-command controls, the Tesla-inspired bike highlights how young innovators are reshaping sustainable, intelligent mobility.

Behaving like animals: Kailash Kher as people jump barricades at his concertThe singer was also seen requesting the senior police personnel to come close to the stage and control the situation. However, there were not many security personnel spotted to bring the crowd under control.

PUCC scam exposed: How Delhi-NCR's pollution checks are being sold like commodityAn India Today investigation revealed how Pollution Under Control Certificates (PUCC) are being issued in Delhi-NCR without properly checking vehicles, and in some cases, without the vehicles even being physically present.

Santa hats, office desks and FA9LA beats, Gurugram workplace dance goes viralA Gurugram office has gained widespread attention after employees were filmed dancing to the viral song FA9LA from Dhurandhar during a Christmas celebration.

sports.headline: Virat Kohli hits rapid 77 in Bengaluru after Rohit Sharma's golden duck in Jaipur Virat Kohli scored 77 runs against Gujarat in the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2025-26. Despite a strong start, he missed out on his second successive century in the tournament.

No show: Rohit Sharma out for 0 in Jaipur, disappointed fans leave stadium Rohit Sharma was dismissed for a golden duck in the Vijay Hazare Trophy match against Uttarakhand. The early wicket left fans disappointed after they braved the winter morning cold to fill the Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur.

Special Report: Ashish Limaye's Historic Asian Gold and Jitu Virwani's Vision for Indian Equestrian In this special report, India Today explores the resilience of Indian equestrian sports amidst administrative crises. Ashish Limaye, the first Indian to win an individual gold at the Asian Equestrian Championships, describes his victory as 'a dream come true' and 'unbelievable'. The report highlights the pivotal role of Jitu Virwani, Chairman of Embassy Group, whose Embassy International Riding School (EIRS) in Bengaluru has become a cradle for champions like Limaye and Fouaad Mirza. Despite the Equestrian Federation of India (EFI) facing infighting and a split Junior National Equestrian Championship, private initiatives like EIRS are ensuring the sport's future. Virwani shares his vision of making the sport 'affordable and accessible' to create a legacy of champions.

Vijay Hazare Trophy live score: Kohli out for 77, Rishabh Pant at crease for Delhi Vijay Hazare Trophy live: Virat Kohli has hit a rapid 29-ball fifty for Delhi against Gujarat. He has looked at his aggressive best. Earlier, Rohit Sharma got dismissed for golden duck against Uttarakhand.

Trivandrum triumph a foregone conclusion? India eye series win vs toothless Sri Lanka IND-W vs SL-W, 3rd T20I: Harmanpreet Kaur's side have dominated the five-match T20I series so far, winning both matches in Vizag and now looking to carry that momentum into Trivandrum.

Harmanpreet Kaur on the cusp of history, set to join Meg Lanning in elite list Harmanpreet Kaur is one win away from becoming the joint most successful T20I captain in history. She will join Meg Lanning at the top of the list with another victory against Sri Lanka.

2026 beckons: Can Rinku Singh finally boss India's T20I middle order? Rinku Singh hasn't enjoyed the best run in T20 cricket over the past couple of years, but a solid campaign at next year's T20 World Cup could prove to be a game-changer for him in the shortest format.

Rohit Sharma's lookalike? Meet Hardik Tamore, Mumbai player who has gone viral Rohit Sharma returned to the Vijay Hazare Trophy with a scintillating hundred against Sikkim. A moment from the game involving Rohit and Mumbai keeper Hardik Tamore went viral on the internet.

How Embassy Riding Club and Ashish Limaye are reshaping equestrian in India Ashish Limaye's Asian gold medal marks a turning point for Indian equestrian sport. Private initiatives like Embassy Riding School are vital amid federation challenges to nurture future talent.

Kartik Sharma on Rs 14.2 crore IPL deal: First, I'll repay my father's loans Young Kartik Sharma fetched a massive sum of Rs 14.20 crore from Chennai Super Kings in the IPL auction. Sharma revealed how he wanted to spend his money.

Deepti Sharma recovers, but is Jemimah Rodrigues fit? India coach shares an updateIND vs SL: India Women are monitoring Jemimah Rodrigues' minor fitness issue ahead of the third T20I against Sri Lanka, while Deepti Sharma's return gives the team management a selection headache.

BPL 2026: Noakhali Express boycott training, coaches charge out of ground in angerNoakhali Express found themselves at the centre of a controversy in the 2026 Bangladesh Premier League (BPL) when coaches Khaled Mahmud Sujon and Talha Jubair stormed out of the ground in frustration over inadequate training facilities in Sylhet.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma return to action. Will BCCI livestream matches?Vijay Hazare Trophy returns with its Round 2 fixtures on Boxing Day. Centurions Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are expected to play on Friday, but will the BCCI livestream the games?

WPL 2026: When and how to buy tickets for upcoming seasonThe tickets for the Women's Premier League (WPL) 2026 will go live on December 26. The tournament is scheduled to take place from January 9 to February 5 in Navi Mumbai and Vadodara.

After T20 World Cup snub, Shubman Gill returns to intense batting practice sessionShubman Gill has responded to his T20 World Cup snub by returning to intense domestic preparations, even as questions grow over his T20 future following further omissions and recent struggles in the format.

SA20 returns for fourth edition: Full teams, format and live-streaming detailsThe fourth edition of the SA20 will get underway on Boxing Day, 26 December 2025, as South Africa prepares for another high-octane season of franchise cricket. Here is all you need to know

No voting rights for clubs in Equestrian Federation elections: Delhi High CourtThe Delhi High Court has ruled that clubs affiliated with the Equestrian Federation of India cannot vote in federation elections. This decision reinforces the governance role of state and Union Territory associations, impacting EFI's electoral structure.

Boozy break behind them, England hope Santa ends Ashes hangover in Boxing Day TestAUS vs ENG: England have already conceded the Ashes, but there is still plenty to play for, especially with the team languishing in the bottom half of the table in the 2025–27 World Test Championship cycle.

Watch: Hardik Pandya ignores abusive fan after refusing selfie requestIndian all-rounder Hardik Pandya remained calm and composed after a fan hurled abuse at him outside a restaurant, earning praise for handling the situation with restraint.

Virat Kohli fully ready for World Cup: Childhood coach backs India legendVirat Kohli is fully ready for the 2027 ODI World Cup, believes his childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma, after the India great marked his return to the Vijay Hazare Trophy with a commanding, record-breaking century for Delhi.

MS Dhoni's role in Jharkhand's historic Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy triumph revealedJSCA joint secretary Shahbaz Nadeem said that MS Dhoni's inputs were taken at every stage of the appointment process before Jharkhand went on to win their first Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy.

Virat Kohli in Vijay Hazare Trophy: Andhra bowler meets his God of CricketVijay Hazare Trophy: For B Vinay Kumar, a young cricketer from Andhra, meeting Virat Kohli and watching him bat felt surreal. Moments like these show why the presence of star players in domestic cricket is important.

16-year-old Tanmay Chaudhary steals the show in DC School CupSixteen-year-old Tanmay Chaudhary announced himself as one of Delhi's most exciting young batting prospects after producing a series of standout performances in the DC School Cup, highlighted by the rare feat of hitting six sixes in an over.

Have India's selectors clarified Yashasvi Jaiswal's white-ball future?Former India captain Dilip Vengsarkar has questioned the selectors for repeatedly leaving Yashasvi Jaiswal out of India's white-ball squads. Jaiswal was not picked in India's squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026.

Manchester United need a saviour? Ex-bidder offers co-owner fresh funds to fix clubFormer Manchester United bidder Thomas Zilliacus has resurfaced with a renewed £375 million proposal for the English club, a move that could inject immediate financial momentum as the Premier League giants approach the January transfer window.

No room for Shubman Gill even in ex-opener's T20 World Cup alternative squadFormer India opener Aakash Chopra did not include Shubman Gill in his alternative T20 World Cup squad, which featured the likes of Yashasvi Jaiswal, KL Rahul, Rishabh Pant and Ruturaj Gaikwad. Gill, who was vice-captain until last month, was also left out of India's 15-man squad for the showpiece event, which begins on February 7.

Watch: Rohit Sharma hugs young Virat Kohli fan during Vijay Hazare clash in JaipurRohit Sharma's Vijay Hazare return delivered runs and a touching moment in Jaipur. A spontaneous hug with a young Virat Kohli fan captured the emotion and enduring magic of India's domestic circuit.

Not ideal: Ashwin's bizarre take on Bihar's world record List A total vs ArunachalIndian spin great Ravichandran Ashwin offered a bizarre view on Vaibhav Suryavanshi-inspired Bihar's record-breaking outing against Arunachal Pradesh in the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2025–26.

Ricky Ponting praises Starc's Ashes impact: Don't think I've seen him bowl betterRicky Ponting has lauded Mitchell Starc for his outstanding performances in the ongoing Ashes, pointing to the clear evolution in his bowling. Starc's impact has been central to Australia establishing a commanding 3-0 lead over England.

Virat Kohli fans climb trees in Bengaluru to watch century: See photosDuring the Vijay Hazare Trophy, while Rohit Sharma enjoyed batting in front of a packed house in Jaipur, Virat Kohli struck a century for Delhi against Andhra in a match played behind closed doors in Bengaluru. Despite the restrictions, a few fans turned up at the BCCI Centre of Excellence and climbed trees to catch a glimpse of their favourite superstar.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
